intro: Bupleurum bicalyculatum, commonly known as the two-lobed bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, branched stems that grow up to 60 centimeters in height. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. Bupleurum bicalyculatum is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
